channel.title: Cache Valley Communities
channel.description: Recent content on Cache Valley Communities

item.title: Cache Tech Community Meetup - Feburuary 2025
item.description: Join us on Feb 22, 2025, at 1:30 PM (MST) at Bridgerland Technical College for a tech meetup focused on programming and networking. The event features an open discussion on tech careers and a hands-on session where attendees will build a chat application in Go. Open to all skill levels—bring your laptop and curiosity!

item.title: Cache Tech Community Meetup - January 2025
item.description: Join us on Jan 25, 2025, at 1:30 PM (MST) at Logan Library for a tech meetup! The event features an open discussion on tech careers and a deep dive into mobile forensics, including an iPhone forensic demo. Open to all skill levels—come learn and connect!

item.title: Why You Should Join Our Official Discord Server
item.description: Join our official Discord server to stay updated, connect with like-minded individuals, ask questions, showcase your projects, and collaborate with the community. Gain access to exclusive events, discussions, and networking opportunities. Be part of a dynamic and supportive space—join today!

item.title: How to Spot and Avoid Scams
item.description: Scams use urgency, emotional manipulation, and too-good-to-be-true offers to deceive victims. Avoid falling for them by verifying sources, being cautious with unsolicited messages, and protecting personal information. Watch for red flags like suspicious payment methods and unprofessional communication. Stay vigilant, trust your instincts, and report any suspicious activity.

item.title: How to Spot and Avoid Scams
item.description: Scams use urgency, emotional manipulation, and too-good-to-be-true offers to deceive victims. item.title: Cache Tech Community Meetup - March 2025
item.description: Join us on MArch 22, 2025, at 1:30 PM (MST) at Bridgerland Technical College for a tech meetup focused on programming and networking. The event features an open discussion on tech careers and a hands-on session where attendees will secure an application in Go*. Open to all skill levels—bring your laptop and curiosity!

item.title: Cache Valley Communities
item.description: Cache Valley Communities is a volunteer-led organization dedicated to bringing people together through events, meetups, and workshops. Our goal is to foster connection, learning, and collaboration while supporting and uniting existing local groups. By creating an inclusive and supportive space, we aim to strengthen the Cache Valley community for everyone.

item.title: DC435 - Cyber Security
item.description: DC435 is a free, community-driven DEFCON group in Cache Valley, UT, focused on InfoSec. Meetings are first Thursdays at 7 PM at Bridgerland Technical College, Logan, UT. Open to all, DC435 fosters learning, collaboration, and respect, with a strict no-harassment policy. Just show up to join!

item.title: W.A.B. Warming Center
item.description: The W.A.B. Warming Center provides a safe, warm space for unhoused individuals and families in Cache Valley, Utah, during the coldest months. It offers resources, supervision, and support to ensure no one is left unsheltered and alone in winter. Families with children are welcome, with safety agreements in place. Visit their official website to learn more.

item.title: Community Resources
item.description:
This page is dedicated to the community resources that we use to collaborate and build together. Below you’ll find links to helpful tools, templates, and other important resources that power our community’s operations.

GitHub

GitHub is where all the magic happens. This is our community GitHub server, where you can access all the resources needed for digital operations, from project repositories to documentation and templates.

In fact, this very website is hosted on GitHub. You can find the source code for this website here. You can also help contribute to make it better!

item.title: Contributors
item.description:
This page is dedicated to the talented individuals who have contributed to the development and growth of this website and its resources. Below you’ll find a list of contributors who have played a significant role in making this project a success.

Contributors

  • Brent Dalling; is the primary contributor to the website, responsible for overseeing the project’s direction, design, and development. You can find more about him on his personal website and see his GitHub contributions here.
